step.cmd: In a web browser, type the address of the StellarOne in the following format:https://<targetserver IP address>. The log on screen will appear.
Enter your credentials (user name and password).

info.p: Use the default credentials of administrator when logging on for the first time:

step.cmd: If this is the first time the StellarOne console being used, follow below procedures to complete the initial settings.

substep.cmd: The Login Information Setup modal window will appear and prompt you to change password. Confirm your password settings:

li.p: Input your new password in New Password text field.
Input the password again in Confirm Password text field.

substep.cmd: Click Confirm. You will be automatically logged out. The Log On screen will appear again.
Log on again using your new credentials.
Enter your first Activation Code, and then click Continue. If you want to enter an activation code for another product, click Enter Another Code instead of Continue.
The EULA/OT Intelligent Trust Agreement screen will appear. Click the links to read the documents carefully and click the checkboxes to proceed to next step.

note.p: It si recommended to enable TXOne OT Intelligent Trust to enhance security deployment Please refer to for more details.

substep.cmd: Specify the time settins such as the Date and Time as well as the Time Zone, and then click Continue.
The StellarOne console is ready for use now.

step.cmd: After the initial settings are completed, the StellarOne allows various user accounts to log on remotely via a web browser.
Type the address of the StellarOne in the following format:https://<targetserver IP address>. The log on screen will appear.
Provide logon credentials, and then click Log On.
(Optional) You can change your password by clicking the ID icon at the top righ corner of the screen, and then click Change Password.
(Optional) For security reason, you can manually log off by clicking the ID icon at the top righ corner of the screen, and then click Log Off.

note.p: Users will be automatically logged off the console if no operations are executed within ?? minutes.
